item.description: Witchcraft and Tombstone Tours Saturday, October 22nd and Sunday, October 23rd For the Halloween season, the Webb-Deane-Stevens Museum has developed a special tour, Tales of Witchcraft and Tombstones. Tours begin in theJoseph Webb House. From there, groups will be led on a walking tour through the Ancient Burying Ground, where the headstones tell many tales. Different headstone designs and the beliefs of the times will be examined, as well as seeing the grave sites of some interesting former residents. Following the Burying Ground tour, visitors will make their way over to the Buttolph-Williams House, which was home to the characters portrayed in the Newbery award-winning book, The Witch of Blackbird Pond by Elizabeth George Speare. Various aspects of the book will be discussed with insights into what their life was like. On Saturday tours go out at 10, 11:30, 1 and 2:30. Sunday tours go out at 1 and 2:30. Cost of this tour is $10 per person. Please call 860-529-0612, ext. 12 for reservations. PLEASE REMEMBER TO BUY YOUR TICKETS AHEAD OF TIME; THIS IS A POPULAR EVENT AND TICKETS ARE LIKELY TO SELL OUT.
item.name: Witchcraft and Tombstone Tours
